title: Vicar Water Country Park Walking and Cycle Route

images.title: Alan Heardman / Vicar Water Country Park - Car Park View of Lake
images.caption: Car Park View of Lake

images.title: Alan Murray-Rust / Vicar Water Visitor Centre
images.caption: Vicar Water Visitor Centre and playground from above. The Country Park has been established on the waste tips of the former Clipstone Colliery and has recently been enhanced by this modern Visitor Centre.

images.title: Alan Heardman / Vicar Water Footpath
images.caption: Vicar Water Footpath. The footpath at this point passes by a smallholding with an impressive line of willow trees.

images.title: James Hill / Vicar Pond at Vicar Water Country Park
images.caption: A long shot of the island in Vicar Pond.

images.title: Alan Heardman / Vicar Water Country Park
images.caption: This footpath heads down from the summit and loops back by the small pond near the car park and Visitors Centre.

images.title: Vicar Water Country Park - Wildfowl on the lake by Ashley Dace, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Wildfowl on the lake

images.title: Graham Hogg / Golden Hand in Vicar Water Country Park
images.caption: Golden Hand. The eye catching 10ft sculpture was specially commissioned as part of the Sustrans National Cycle Route, which runs through the Park. Here it appears to be grasping the headstocks of the former Clipstone Colliery.

images.title: Alan Heardman / Vicar Water Country Park - Hill View
images.caption: Hill View. This view gives a clear indication of the amount of woodland and forestry adjoining the country park.

description: Explore 200 acres of rare heathland, mature woodland and species rich grassland in this country park near Mansfield. The park offers spectacular views across to Derbyshire and Lincolnshire and is home to an abundance of wildlife including herons, kingfishers, foxes, hares, tawny owls, nightjar and woodpeckers. There are also two bodies of water - Vicar Pond and Vicar Water. Vicar Water has super footpaths and bridleways making it ideal for a short cycle or walk. National Cycle Network number 6 runs through the park so you could continue your cycle along the Nottingham to Worksop cycle route. You could also visit the nearby Sherwood Pines Forest Park and enjoy several waymarked cycling and walking trails. Our Mansfield Cycle Route starts at Vicar Water and visits the splendid Clumber Park. It's a nice way to visit both parks on your bike in a day.

details.subtitle: Pubs/Cafes
details.content: There's an on site cafe at the visitor centre selling a good range of meals and snacks. You can sit outside and enjoy a nice view of the park with your refreshments.

details.subtitle: Dog Walking
details.content: The park is a popular place with dog walkers so you'll probably see plenty of other owners on your visit.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: Just a few miles to the north there's Sherwood Forest Country Park where you can pay a visit to the famous Major Oak. You can access the park from the pretty village of Edwinstowe which lies just to the south of the expansive park.

display_address: Vicar Water Car Park, Eastfield Close, Clipstone, Newark and Sherwood, Nottinghamshire, East Midlands, England, NG21 9AZ, United Kingdom
